pulltitle: Add Mozilla Code of Conduct
pullsbody:
Fixes #17


As of January 1 2019, Mozilla requires that all GitHub projects include this [CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md](https://github.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) file in the project root. The file has two parts:

1. Required Text - All text under the headings *Community Participation Guidelines and How to Report*, are required, and should not be altered.
2. Optional Text - The Project Specific Etiquette heading provides a space to speak more specifically about ways people can work effectively and inclusively together. Some examples of those can be found on the [Firefox Debugger](https://github.com/devtools-html/debugger.html/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md) project, and [Common Voice](https://github.com/mozilla/voice-web/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md). (The optional part is commented out in the [raw template file](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mozilla/repo-templates/blob/master/templates/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md), and will not be visible until you modify and uncomment that part.)

If you have any questions about this file, or Code of Conduct policies and procedures, please see [Mozilla-GitHub-Standards](https://wiki.mozilla.org/GitHub/Repository_Requirements) or email Mozilla-GitHub-Standards+CoC@mozilla.com.

_(Message COC002)_
pull_commit_message:
Add Mozilla Code of Conduct file

Fixes #17.

_(Message COC002)_

pulltitle: Merge latest strings from activity-stream changeset d4f38b1b8a2c4eaeb2940ec509ad068ab00e67da
pullsbody:
String changes from https://github.com/mozilla/activity-stream/pull/3951

The thinking of keeping the strings until "after 60" is because strings still get localized through beta. E.g., currently nightly 60 has beta 59 strings in pontoon, so only remove the no-longer-needed-in-60 strings towards the end of beta 59 after "final locale check" and before nightly-60->beta-60 merge day.

Before:
![screen shot 2018-01-29 at 9 32 48 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/438537/35524982-057e9f5c-04d8-11e8-8e33-8aeadde73b2c.png)

After:
![screen shot 2018-01-29 at 9 31 44 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/438537/35524972-01a5cb9e-04d8-11e8-8fcc-9948535dd525.png)
pull_commit_message: Merge latest strings from activity-stream changeset d4f38b1b8a2c4eaeb2940ec509ad068ab00e67da

pulltitle: Merge latest strings from activity-stream changeset a0de7329abfd9b498c08e048e82aa12325dc64bb
pullsbody:
@flodolo, do we want this export given that it's specific to Pocket, which is currently only shown in English for US/Canada and German for Germany, and we already have some unofficial German translations from a German-speaking developer.

Pocket disclaimer: https://github.com/mozilla/activity-stream/pull/3774
Pocket sponsored experiment: https://github.com/mozilla/activity-stream/pull/3663

Will exporting the unofficial de strings to pontoon make it seem like it's already translated without needing translations?

pulltitle: Improve README, clean up locales, add l10n.toml
pullsbody:
This PR:
* Improves README.md with a few links
* Remove empty locales. Pontoon now syncs only when there's actual activity, in the past it used to commit files with only comments.
* Add a l10n.toml file

l10n.toml is used by a Python package called compare-locales, and lets you check the status of a locale, for example

```
compare-locales l10n.toml . it
```

Resulting in

```
it:
changed: 87
changed_w: 366
unchanged: 4
unchanged_w: 4
95% of entries changed
```

You can also run it on all locales if you want, and search for errors.
```
compare-locales l10n.toml . `ls l10n`
```

See also
https://github.com/mozilla/send/issues/357
pull_commit_message: Update README.md
